snippet: Tension with the police in Brooklyn stayed high on a third night of protests, after an autopsy showed that seven bullets had struck Kimani Gray, 16.
abstract: Tension with the police in Brooklyn remains high on third night of protests for shooting death of teenager Kimani Gray; anger increased after autopsy showed that seven bullets from police struck Gray, including three that entered his body from the rear.

byline.contributor: Patrick McGeehan, Wendy Ruderman and Tim Stelloh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Tension with the police in Brooklyn stayed high on a third night of protests, after an autopsy showed that seven bullets had struck Kimani Gray, 16.

headline.seo: Anger in Brooklyn at Killing of Kimani Gray, 16, by Police
headline.main: Anger in East Flatbush Persists Over Teenager’s Killing by the Police
headline.print_headline: Anger in East Flatbush Persists Over Teenager’s Killing by the Police
